data.title: CollisionShape is not part of the scene tree
data.body:
CollisionShapes appear not to be part of the scene tree. 
If you add a CollisionShape in the editor and assing a script to it the _ready() function won't be called.
Also get_node( <path/to/CollisionShape> )  will return null for both absolute and relative paths.
This applies for 2D and 3D.

data.title: Fix some incorrect bindings in PhysicsServer
data.body: Some functions in PhysicsServer weren't bound to their respective functions.

data.title: editor crashes after deleting CollisionPolygon2D node
data.body:
Place a CollisionPolygon2D node in your scene. Edit it if you want. Go do other stuff if you want. Come back later if you want. Or not. It doesn't matter!
Delete it using the X button or Del key.
Click somewhere in the 2D project view pane.
Godot crashes.
???
Profit.

data.title: editor is processing gamepad input
data.body:
I found out that the Godot editor is processing gamepad input. Pushing some buttons on a gamepad may result in the focus moving around, and if you're not careful, changes made to your scene (including deletion of nodes, even the root node).

It seems to process joystick input even behind the scenes of a running project which is also processing joystick input. I'm using Linux.

data.title: Animations are not resetting properly when played in the editor.
data.body:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/67740160/AnimationsNotResetingInEditor.webm

I've noticed if I wanted the animation to reset properly in the editor, I had to either play it and VERY quickly stop it, play it and then rewind the animation back to the start, then (and this is the buggy bit) if I wanted the animated item to work properly again I had to first select it.

The keyframes are at 0 and 0.5, by the way. https://mediencenter.t-online.de/auth/guest/shareToken/DDE241350EA1C553A3945179DF687D896509C0DF is the example uploaded by Wendigo on http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=1024

data.title: Fix Export -> image group panel
data.body:
1.click group item doe's not refresh group_images
2.Switch to Atlas mode that preview button doe's not shown

data.title: Fix AtlasTexture not display correct in StyleBoxTexture
Add preview for image-groups panel
data.body: i was add preview support, for better use in editor:

data.title: Azerty keyboard layout not working inside the editor on OS X
data.body:
It seems that for some reason the Godot editor does not recognise my Azerty keyboard layout. It thinks that I am using a Qwerty keyboard.

For example:
When I want to undo an operation I need to press "Meta + W" instead of "Meta + Z". If you compare Qwerty and Azerty, you see that the W and Q keys are reversed. Other shortcuts show the same behaviour: "Meta + A" and "Meta + Q" are flipped as well.

The strange thing is, they keys work as expected inside the script editor..

data.title: Making object hierarchy more explicit in help pages.
data.body: By this, I mean having something like (for example) "Object > Node > Control > Panel" at the top of the help page for panel, so you can click on any of the others to be taken to the relevant help page.

data.title: Particle2D Node -> Converting to Subscene
data.body:
Converting a Particle2D Node to a Subscene doesn't copy any settings of the particles.
You have to completely recreate all settings of the particle system which is super annoying because there are so many! :-)

Would be nice if this can be fixed somehow ^^

data.title: Handling Player Desktop Resolution
data.body:
Currently in Godot, we have to choose a pre-determined resolution for our games. On PC platforms this leads to an issue where you render your game at a higher resolution than the player screen resolution. For instance if you choose 1920x1080 for your game and the player has a 1280x720 or 1600x.. screen, it would be display with stretch mode, but it would also be a big waste of resources.

What we would need to address this kind of situations is to have at least two functions:
- one for querying the player desktop resolution
- another another one so we can change the project settings -> display -> width/height at runtime (or at least at boot time).

This way we could choose the appropriate resolution for the game and use the "fullscreen" option without the need (at least on Windows) to change the player screen actual resolution (which most players do not like).

data.title: InterpolatedCamera does not work properly!
data.body: InterpolatedCamera does not work properly if its parent has non-default transform.

data.title: randomize() isn't work some time
data.body:
``` javascript
extends Node
func _ready():
    randomize()
    print(randi())
```

Issue is it will random same value every times when run scene, it occur around midnight of day

data.title: Scene Tree can now display full instanced scenes hierarchy
data.body:
- Scene Tree can now display full instanced scenes hierarchy, useful to keyframe any parameter from any instanced scene children, no matter how deep they are in he hierarchy.
- The root of an instanced scene get the same color as its children. There is no reason to treat it differently, they are all part of the instanced scene. This way you get an instant overview of which nodes are part of an instanced scene and which are not.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1168072/4676114/20b1abfc-55d6-11e4-82e6-156031f9698c.png)

data.title: Scene Tree can now display full instanced scenes hierarchy
data.body:
- Scene Tree can now display full instanced scenes hierarchy, useful to keyframe any parameter from any instanced scene children, no matter how deep they are in he hierarchy.
- The root of an instanced scene get the same color as its children. There is no reason to treat it differently, they are all part of the instanced scene. This way you get an instant overview of which nodes are part of an instanced scene and which are not.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1168072/4670046/7dbc3cb2-5573-11e4-9170-ae3e611bc1e6.png)

data.title: Animation Player Does Not Keep Play Parameter (always "stop")
data.body:
Whatever animation you set as Playback -> Play parameter, AnimationPlayer keeps using "stop".

1) Create an animation track and some keyframes.
2) Set it as the AnimationPlayer Play mode.
3) Select another node.
4) Select back the AnimationPlayer node.
5) Play now shows "stop" instead of the previously selected animation.

data.title: Fix light was always been disabled in release mode (tools=no)
- Right mouse button now work the same as middle mouse button in 3d view...
data.body: .../Godot navigation mode for orbit/pan/zoom.

data.title: FileSystem Tab Enhancements
data.body:
1) Fold folders by default. (*edit:* see #7488, fixed by #7492)
When you have a large amount of assets in folders trees you end up with the very long tree widget content.

2) An option to Unfold/Fold all Folders at once. (fixed by #7492)

3) Remember state of the FileSystem Tab (including the currently selected file, folded/unfolded folders,..) no matter what (saving a scene reset selection, refreshing reset folding,..)

4) Add ability to "tick" Folders as well as Files so we can isolate a Folder (and its content) with the "Star" icon.

5) CTRL+Tick a file or a folder would "untick" all other "ticked" files/folders
CTRL or wathever modifier.

data.title: Lost ability to compile without 3d nodes
data.body:
marynate re-introduced this feature ( http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=669&start=10#p3329 ) here: https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/pull/569

but it seems that the flags disable_3d=yes module_gridmap_enabled=no tools=no doesn't work anylonger from this commit: https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/commit/0c7b75d8d82d7a0c2b9347c7a2096a86a349fe7f

test made on ubuntu 14.04, command:
scons platform=android disable_3d=yes module_gridmap_enabled=no tools=no target=release

on commit 247e7ed716a4c0bd5140c2b2a938f7118e84fb14 compile successfully

on commit 0c7b75d8d82d7a0c2b9347c7a2096a86a349fe7f (the next one) compile fails.

data.title: Translation, scale and rotation handles often can't be focused and dragged
data.body:
It often works when Godot was just started up and on a new object/node.
But after working a bit and modifying an object, it's very difficult and sometimes impossible to get a grip on the handles.

data.title: Collision Shape Clone Zombies
data.body:
1. Create spatial
2. Add static body to that
3. Add Collision shape to that
4. Add rigid body with key controls to test the collision shape at runtime
5. Select the collision shape and duplicate it
6. Delete the original collision shape
7. Run the game and see that the original collision shape is still there, in addition to the duplicate.

data.title: fix view dependent problem in normal mapping
Directory Object broken
data.body:
Hey there..
I had a program which could create create directories and rename files.
With an older godot version everthing works fine. But with the current ones Directory is broken.
I still can create direcotories this way:
var dir = Directory.new()
dir.open("/")
dir.make_dir(dir_path)

But if I want to check if a dir exists or not the checks fail. I also cannot rename files anymore.

data.title: Fix ios build error
data.body: Fixed missing glsl headers on ios build

data.title: scaled tilemap exports incorrectly to Android
data.body:
After doubling the cell size of a tilemap, and halving the tilemap node's scale (to allow higher resolution sprites in the same tilemap space), the exported tilemap appears at half its proper scale when exported to Android.  The tiles are drawn at the correct scale, causing them to overlap each other.  It appears correct on PC.  This is a recent behavior, probably caused by the recent tilemap changes (hexagonal, etc).

Example project:
https://copy.com/2sqpGEooQksU2L2c

data.title: Collision information doesn't update until sub-scene has been removed and added again
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Load the project in https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B4_eMtVgfcUHTkVINVIzUk01UWM/view?usp=sharing
2. run the program and you can see the player can run into the tree (use wasd to move)
3. open the arbol scene

You'll notice this scene has no collision object but the player was still able to run in to it
1. go back to 1.scn
2. remove the arbol sub-scene
3. add the arbol sub-scene again
4. run the game again

You will no longer be be able to run in to the tree. So it seems al of the information related to the sub-scene is updated except for the collision object.
